answers.answer: hi,that is a tough one.  As you want your eyesight to be relatively stable when you get the glasses.Maybe you need to ask your dr about this one.  however, if your eyes have changed dramatically, maybe you should just get a cheap pair to help with current vision.

question: I have always been extremely nearsighted, diabetic retinopathy has further reduced my vision.  I am getting Lucentis injections for the retina damage and they are working very well.   I know I need new glasses but when should I get them?  My vision can change tremendously from day to day.  I believe the cause is lack of sleep and stress(Iam sole caregiver for my mother who as an especially violent type of dementia. She is hell to deal with).  My blood glucose is pretty good.type 2 diabetes
title: When should I get new glasses?
